channel.title: Making an item 2 handed
channel.description: Well I got a delta source (Don't worry, I'm not gay. I'm making it so I can make tutorials and stuff.) And I finally finished dragon claws, but I wear em along with a shield and my gloves. How can I make it so you can wear them without the shield and gloves?

item.title: Making an item 2 handed
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“9d n 1 n e, post:7, topic:275049”][quote author=noobspure50 link=topic=363376.msg2760068#msg2760068 date=1240465632]
search that and add your item id in that

int[] two_hand =

[/quote]
fail, thought you were spoon feeding?
search int[] two_hand in client.java and you will see numbers in a braket, just add the item id
in there and your set.[/quote]
What’s the difference between your ‘tutorial’ and his?

Read full topic

item.title: Making an item 2 handed
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Packet 41.

case 41: // wear item int wearID = inStream.readUnsignedWord(); int wearSlot = inStream.readUnsignedWordA(); interfaceID = inStream.readUnsignedWordA(); int targetSlot = 0; targetSlot = itemType(wearID); int[] two_hand = { 1319, 4718, 4726, 1409, 4710, 7158, 15333, 15334, 15335, 15336, 15156, 4153, 6528, 3204 }; for (int element : two_hand) { if ((wearID == element) && (playerEquipment[playerShield] > 0)) { if (playerHasItem(-1)) { remove(playerEquipment[playerShield], 5); } else { msgSend("You do not have enough inventory space to do that."); return; } } if ((itemType(wearID) == playerShield) && (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == element)) { if (playerHasItem(-1)) { remove(playerEquipment[playerWeapon], 3); } else { msgSend("You can't wear a shield with this weapon"); return; } } } wear(wearID, wearSlot); flushOutStream(); break;

Read full topic
